text: From yesterday's @TheSVO Policy Mtg. w/ @kellyhkline and @buildingsanjose:  @VTA's Prelim Signature Project Blossom Hill from @RepublicUrban & @EAHHousing - will City allow them to provide dense #units and minimize #parking & #Retail ?  @JohnnyKhamis
text_html: From yesterday's @TheSVO Policy Mtg. w/ @kellyhkline and @buildingsanjose: @VTA's Prelim Signature Project Blossom Hill from @RepublicUrban & @EAHHousing - will City allow them to provide dense #units and minimize #parking & #Retail ? @JohnnyKhamis

text: That was approved in 2016, so not sure what could be done now? We worked with City of Santa Clara to pass a $20/sq ft Commercial Linkage Fee on large offices projects shortly after to ensure more affordable housing $$ from big projects, something we still need in San Jose.
text_html: That was approved in 2016, so not sure what could be done now? We worked with City of Santa Clara to pass a $20/sq ft Commercial Linkage Fee on large offices projects shortly after to ensure more affordable housing $$ from big projects, something we still need in San Jose.

text:
Hey @CityofSanJose @SCCgov @sliccardo @buildingsanjose 
 What do I have to do to start raising and selling chickens from my backyard?
text_html: Hey @CityofSanJose @SCCgov @sliccardo @buildingsanjose What do I have to do to start raising and selling chickens from my backyard?

text: Thanks!  We do like the pre-approval idea though.  We hear from neighbors that despite the streamlining the permitting and inspections are very time-consuming.
text_html: Thanks! We do like the pre-approval idea though. We hear from neighbors that despite the streamlining the permitting and inspections are very time-consuming.

#DidYouKnow @CityofSanJose has an ADU Amnesty program? If you've built an ADU that isn't up to code, this program from @buildingsanjose can help you out!

text: Commute to work everyday and post it. Fix the public transportation first then you come with this conversation for people who live far away from downtown or work in other cities. You all talk a lot but don’t do nothing to improve public transportation and safety.
text_html: Commute to work everyday and post it. Fix the public transportation first then you come with this conversation for people who live far away from downtown or work in other cities. You all talk a lot but don’t do nothing to improve public transportation and safety.

text: It's no mistake that today's @CityofSanJose council housing items cater to #developers. If the City, @sjcityhousing & @buildingsanjose spent half as much time talking to SJ renters as they do taking orders from developers this rush to change policy would not be happening today. pic.twitter.com/eHA3naxBlu
text_html: It's no mistake that today's @CityofSanJose council housing items cater to #developers. If the City, @sjcityhousing & @buildingsanjose spent half as much time talking to SJ renters as they do taking orders from developers this rush to change policy would not be happening today. pic.twitter.com/eHA3naxBlu

text: OK. But @CityofSanJose calculates 100% of the two dimensional space (I.E. square feet) to deduce it’s arbitrary goal of “20% jobs producing land”. If the southern part of San Jose *is* mostly suburbs (and ur right, it is), can we net it from our housing-denying-math equations?
text_html: OK. But @CityofSanJose calculates 100% of the two dimensional space (I.E. square feet) to deduce it’s arbitrary goal of “20% jobs producing land”. If the southern part of San Jose *is* mostly suburbs (and ur right, it is), can we net it from our housing-denying-math equations?

text: As a former resident of Nashville- many great things San Jose can learn from that city- how clean it is, how much pride they have, social events, how church + govt assist homeless great programs ... can’t say enough good things!
text_html: As a former resident of Nashville- many great things San Jose can learn from that city- how clean it is, how much pride they have, social events, how church + govt assist homeless great programs ... can’t say enough good things!

text: In #Nashville today with TheSVO. MayorBriley is 8 days away from Election Day but was gracious enough to meet with us. You can get a building permit here in 90 days! Here’s hoping we can bring that back to San José! cc: buildingsanjose https://twitter.com/LTDiep/status/1169275331343241222 … via SanJoseVoice
text_html: In #Nashville today with TheSVO. MayorBriley is 8 days away from Election Day but was gracious enough to meet with us. You can get a building permit here in 90 days! text: Community Meeting - Sept 12, 6pm at School of Arts and Culture at the Mexican Heritage Plaza. text: Commute to work everyday and post it. Fix the public transportation first then you come with this conversation for people who live far away from downtown or work in other cities. You all talk a lot but don’t do nothing to improve public transportation and safety.
text_html: Commute to work everyday and post it. Fix the public transportation first then you come with this conversation for people who live far away from downtown or work in other cities. You all talk a lot but don’t do nothing to improve public transportation and safety.

text: It's no mistake that today's @CityofSanJose council housing items cater to #developers. If the City, @sjcityhousing & @buildingsanjose spent half as much time talking to SJ renters as they do taking orders from developers this rush to change policy would not be happening today. pic.twitter.com/eHA3naxBlu
text_html: It's no mistake that today's @CityofSanJose council housing items cater to #developers. If the City, @sjcityhousing & @buildingsanjose spent half as much time talking to SJ renters as they do taking orders from developers this rush to change policy would not be happening today. pic.twitter.com/eHA3naxBlu

text: OK. But @CityofSanJose calculates 100% of the two dimensional space (I.E. square feet) to deduce it’s arbitrary goal of “20% jobs producing land”. If the southern part of San Jose *is* mostly suburbs (and ur right, it is), can we net it from our housing-denying-math equations?
text_html: OK. But @CityofSanJose calculates 100% of the two dimensional space (I.E. square feet) to deduce it’s arbitrary goal of “20% jobs producing land”. If the southern part of San Jose *is* mostly suburbs (and ur right, it is), can we net it from our housing-denying-math equations?

text: As a former resident of Nashville- many great things San Jose can learn from that city- how clean it is, how much pride they have, social events, how church + govt assist homeless great programs ... can’t say enough good things!
text_html: As a former resident of Nashville- many great things San Jose can learn from that city- how clean it is, how much pride they have, social events, how church + govt assist homeless great programs ... can’t say enough good things!

text: In #Nashville today with TheSVO. MayorBriley is 8 days away from Election Day but was gracious enough to meet with us. You can get a building permit here in 90 days! Here’s hoping we can bring that back to San José! cc: buildingsanjose https://twitter.com/LTDiep/status/1169275331343241222 … via SanJoseVoice
